intro: Walafrida zuurbergensis, commonly known as the Zuurberg daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a border plant. Walafrida zuurbergensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
